description: Massachusetts General Hospital Holiday travel usually means hitting the road to see family members and loved ones. This past weekend, 26 Mass General staff members boarded a plane as a part of an emergency response deployment team headed to Puerto Rico. Two months after Hurricane Maria, much of the Caribbean islands still remain in crisis. Organized by the Center for Disaster Medicine and  Mass General Global Health , the team includes 15 registered nurses, 5 physicians, 4 nurse practitioners, 1 physician assistant and 1 logistics/security effort. They will spend 16 days helping local Puerto Ricans in pediatric care, adult primary care and emergency care. Thank you to this team for helping in a time of need!

description: Massachusetts General Hospital # TBT  Have you ever wondered about the history of Boston‚Äôs Annual Tree Lighting? On December 6, 1917, there was a devastating explosion in Halifax, Nova Scotia, that resulted in 2,000 fatalities, 6,000 injured and at least 9,000 people homeless. Mass General sent relief and staff members to help. The following year, Halifax sent a Christmas tree to Boston as thanks. This year marks the centennial of the Halifax disaster, and the November 30th Tree Lighting on the  Boston Common  will pay special tribute to first responders.
